definition: to hold fast to/to stick to
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: The Russian official assessed that Pyongyang was "hunkering down for a succession crisis.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯官员认为朝鲜会坚守继承的传统。

sentences.english: The enemy attacked in great numbers but our men stood their ground.
sentences.chinese: 敌人大举进攻，但我方战士仍坚守阵地。

sentences.english: B: Stick with the basics until you know them really well.
sentences.chinese: 坚守住基本原理，直到你了然于心。

sentences.english: There can be no question of holding forth on ethics.
sentences.chinese: 这里谈不上坚守道德准绳的问题。

sentences.english: Have faith, Mr. Reagan asked his party and his country.
sentences.chinese: 里根对他的政党和国家的要求是坚守信念。

sentences.english: Present a vocational award to someone in the community who has exemplified outstanding professional achievement while maintaining very high ethical standards.
sentences.chinese: 他坚守著非常高道德标准而且已有了杰出职业的成就。

sentences.english: Every man stayed at his post; and, by their great courage, they managed to save the ship from sinking.
sentences.chinese: 大家都坚守岗位，终于以极大的勇力使船沉没。

sentences.english: "We'll defend the Wall to the last man, " said Cotter Pyke.
sentences.chinese: “我们会坚守长城到剩最后一个人”卡特派克说道。

sentences.english: He stood fast at his post despite all difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 他不顾一切困难坚守岗位。

sentences.english: He persevered with his task until he had succeeded in collecting an armful of firewood.
sentences.chinese: 他坚守着他的目标，直到成功收集了一抱木柴。

sentences.english: Stick to post it day and night, constantly turning.
sentences.chinese: 它日日夜夜地坚守岗位，一刻不停地转动着。

sentences.english: Never lie, cheat or steal, always strike a fair deal.
sentences.chinese: 决不撒谎，欺瞒或偷盗，坚守平允买卖。

sentences.english: Mr. Gbagbo used a New Year's Eve address to say that he will remain in office.
sentences.chinese: 巴博利用除夕夜讲话机会表示自己将坚守总统职位。

sentences.english: Still, he stuck to his post, reporting the water level to his headquarters every15 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 他仍坚守岗位，每一刻钟向指挥部报告一次水情。

sentences.english: "I don't want to get any messages saying, "I am holding my position."
sentences.chinese: “我不希望听到“我正在坚守阵地。”

definition: to persevere with/to persist in/to insist on
(one's) original intention, aspiration etc/(Buddhism) "beginner's mind" (i.e. having an attitude of openness when studying a subject just as a beginner in that subject would)
to hold on to/to defend/to keep/to guard
to be strongly attached to/to be dedicated/to cling to
to fight bravely/(fig.) to struggle/to work hard
